intro: Tithymalus macrocladus, commonly known as the large-leaved tithymalus, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to parts of southern Africa. It features lance-shaped leaves that are often hairy and have a distinct basal rosette structure. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in a dense, terminal cluster, typically blooming in late spring to early summer. Its flowering stems are usually unbranched and can grow up to 30 centimeters in height. Tithymalus macrocladus is adapted to dry, rocky environments and is often found in grassland ecosystems.
